paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant N588K, including penetrance data and functional effects.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Experiences recurrent syncope and documented ventricular arrhythmias.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with syncope at age 25 and was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 28.
The patient was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 21 after experiencing atrial fibrillation.
The individual was found to carry the N588K variant but remains asymptomatic.
The patient reported palpitations and was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 39.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation leads to a gain-of-function effect on the hERG channel, resulting in increased IKr current and abbreviated action potential duration.

variants.segregation_data: The N588K variant segregates with disease in affected families.
variants.population_frequency: Not available in gnomAD or ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the arrhythmogenic potential of the N588K variant in SQT1.
key_quotes: The N588K mutation facilitates initiation and maintenance of ventricular re-entry.
The abbreviated QT interval in the simulations reproduces a key feature of the ECGs recorded from SQT1 patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
